pull.title: build: replace `WERROR` with `CMAKE_COMPILE_WARNING_AS_ERROR`
pull.body:
`CMAKE_COMPILE_WARNING_AS_ERROR` was added to CMake in 3.24.

`--compile-no-warning-as-error` can be used, if needed, in future, to
suppress the `CMAKE_COMPILE_WARNING_AS_ERROR` behaviour from a CI
config.

Potential alternative to #33297. Closes #33284.

See https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/prop_tgt/COMPILE_WARNING_AS_ERROR.html.

events.body: The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers. ### Reviews See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process. | Type | Reviewers | | ---- | --------- | | ACK | [hebasto](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34504#pullrequestreview-3758265460), [purpleKarrot](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34504#issuecomment-3855114885), [maflcko](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34504#issuecomment-3855368901) | If your review is incorrectly listed, please copy-paste <!--meta-tag:bot-skip--> into the comment that the bot should ignore.

I guess this will make `ci/test/00_setup_env_native_previous_releases.sh:export CI_IMAGE_NAME_TAG="mirror.gcr.io/ubuntu:22.04"` pass on all compile warnings, but maybe this is fine and we only care about hard compile failures there?

I think it would be better to hardcode `-Werror` in the flags of this CI config ?

lgtm.


Would be nice to provide (and push) a diff to inject a warning (maybe a missing Wswitch or Wunused function?), so that the CI result can be confirmed for all tasks and local testing is easier.

> Would be nice to provide (and push)

Pushed.

Also checked (on alpine with gcc 15.x) that this would catch the same trailing whitespace issue recently seen with secp256k1:
```bash
In file included from /bitcoin/src/secp256k1/src/util.h:10,
                 from /bitcoin/src/secp256k1/src/field.h:10,
                 from /bitcoin/src/secp256k1/src/group.h:10,
                 from /bitcoin/src/secp256k1/src/precomputed_ecmult_gen.c:3:
/bitcoin/src/secp256k1/src/../include/secp256k1.h:17:52: error: trailing whitespace [-Werror=trailing-whitespace=]
   17 |  *    they describe, even if this violates rule 1.
cc1: all warnings being treated as errors
gmake[2]: *** [src/secp256k1/src/CMakeFiles/secp256k1_precomputed.dir/build.make:93: src/secp256k1/src/CMakeFiles/secp256k1_precomputed.dir/precomputed_ecmult_gen.c.o] Error 1
```
Everything that was expected to fail, has failed, except for MSVC. I guess we don't get warnings there for missing cases in a switch?

Concept ACK.

> `CMAKE_COMPILE_WARNING_AS_ERROR` was added to CMake in 3.24.

Since its usage is not guarded by CMake policies, it does not depend on the minimum version defined here:: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/eb97250421d35f8c172d43b69965af6273025702/CMakeLists.txt#L10

ACK f6386d8e06f382e95aba53a5f100d41b4d3744db

Love it. `CMAKE_COMPILE_WARNING_AS_ERROR` is set in the build scripts and logic is removed from `CMakeLists.txt`.

ACK f6386d8e06f382e95aba53a5f100d41b4d3744db, tested on Ubuntu 25.10. I've verified compiler flags in the `secp256k1` subtree in verbose mode.

Still suggesting to [ditch](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34504#discussion_r2769931138) `NO_WERROR` as well.

nit: In the commit message s/`DWERROR`/`WERROR`/.

verification.payload:
tree e15e20b27c380135a9de1c6625e9276696dd0c30
parent eb97250421d35f8c172d43b69965af6273025702
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1769601187 +0000
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1770309554 +0000

build: replace WERROR with CMAKE_COMPILE_WARNING_AS_ERROR

-Werror is added to the previous releases job, given it runs on Ubuntu
22.04, which uses an older CMake.

`--compile-no-warning-as-error` can be used, if needed, in future, to
suppress the `CMAKE_COMPILE_WARNING_AS_ERROR` behaviour from a CI
config.

CMAKE_COMPILE_WARNING_AS_ERROR was added to CMake in 3.24.
See https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/prop_tgt/COMPILE_WARNING_AS_ERROR.html.

Co-authored-by: willcl-ark <will8clark@gmail.com>

events.message:
build: replace WERROR with CMAKE_COMPILE_WARNING_AS_ERROR

-Werror is added to the previous releases job, given it runs on Ubuntu
22.04, which uses an older CMake.

`--compile-no-warning-as-error` can be used, if needed, in future, to
suppress the `CMAKE_COMPILE_WARNING_AS_ERROR` behaviour from a CI
config.

CMAKE_COMPILE_WARNING_AS_ERROR was added to CMake in 3.24.
See https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/prop_tgt/COMPILE_WARNING_AS_ERROR.html.

Co-authored-by: willcl-ark <will8clark@gmail.com>

events.body: Fixed the commit message, took @willcl-ark change, update OP to mention `--compile-no-warning-as-error` as possible to use in CI configs going forward.

re-ACK 322c4ec4422a2e03fc81e61b1315b1245ba47d2f

Note that `--compile-no-warning-as-error` is intended to be used in build scripts to override `COMPILE_WARNING_AS_ERROR` properties set by the project in the case where project authors want to enforce `-Werror` behavior for local development, but builders want to track warnings separately from errors in CI. We currently do the opposite: We enable `-Werror` for CI.

review ACK 322c4ec4422a2e03fc81e61b1315b1245ba47d2f 

<details><summary>Show signature</summary>

Signature:

```
untrusted comment: signature from minisign secret key on empty file; verify via: minisign -Vm "${path_to_any_empty_file}" -P RWTRmVTMeKV5noAMqVlsMugDDCyyTSbA3Re5AkUrhvLVln0tSaFWglOw -x "${path_to_this_whole_four_line_signature_blob}"
RUTRmVTMeKV5npGrKx1nqXCw5zeVHdtdYURB/KlyA/LMFgpNCs+SkW9a8N95d+U4AP1RJMi+krxU1A3Yux4bpwZNLvVBKy0wLgM=

```

</details>

This change seems to prevent the option from showing up in `ccmake` ? Previously I could run `ccmake build/` to turn WERROR on, but now I don't seem to see the new `CMAKE_COMPILE_WARNING_AS_ERROR` option at all.
@ajtowns I don't really use `ccmake`, so not sure. @hebasto or @purpleKarrot might know?

Looks like the configure summary will now omit the output by default:

```
...
Treat compiler warnings as errors ..... 
Use ccache for compiling .............. ON

> Looks like the configure summary will now omit the output by default:
> 
> ```
> ...
> Treat compiler warnings as errors ..... 
> Use ccache for compiling .............. ON
> ```

I get different output:

```bash
 cmake --version
cmake version 4.1.2

 cmake -B build -DCMAKE_COMPILE_WARNING_AS_ERROR=ON

<snip>
Treat compiler warnings as errors ..... ON
Use ccache for compiling .............. ON
```

but I also do not see the toggle in `ccmake`, even with "Toggle advanced mode".

edit: Oh I see you said *by default*, in which case you are correct:

```bash
Treat compiler warnings as errors .....
Use ccache for compiling .............. ON
```
Opened https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34605 which adds CMAKE_COMPILE_WARNING_AS_ERROR as a cache vairable to have it show a value when unset, and allow it to be modified by `ccmake`.

comments.body: nit: Maybe document that this is only a temporary workaround until a later cmake version is used here?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -86,7 +86,7 @@ if [ -z "$NO_DEPENDS" ]; then
   BITCOIN_CONFIG_ALL="${BITCOIN_CONFIG_ALL} -DCMAKE_TOOLCHAIN_FILE=$DEPENDS_DIR/$HOST/toolchain.cmake"
 fi
 if [ -z "$NO_WERROR" ]; then
-  BITCOIN_CONFIG_ALL="${BITCOIN_CONFIG_ALL} -DWERROR=ON"
+  BITCOIN_CONFIG_ALL="${BITCOIN_CONFIG_ALL} -DCMAKE_COMPILE_WARNING_AS_ERROR=ON"
 fi
comments.body:
As far as I can see nothing ever sets `$NO_WERROR`, so this is unconditionally hit and, if this is intended, could be clarified to:

```suggestion
BITCOIN_CONFIG_ALL="${BITCOIN_CONFIG_ALL} -DCMAKE_COMPILE_WARNING_AS_ERROR=ON"
```
